channel.title: Messup with server being online? what happens when ppl try to log onto my server
channel.description: Hey, I turned on my no-ip DUC, I turned on my utorrent to port 43595(can't use 43594). I tried to post my server on moparscape server status page but it never came on there...-.- Next, I asked my friend to go on. He clicked once, [i]error connecting to server.[/i] Next time, it said [i]Unexpected server response. Please use a different world.[/i] I never ip-baned anyone! What's wrong? P.S. if this helps, I tried to to port forward but i don't know if I did it correctly.

item.title: Messup with server being online? what happens when ppl try to log onto my server
item.dc:creator: @needhoster needhoster
item.description:
@needhoster wrote:

[quote=“mastercoder, post:7, topic:241908”]:eek: :eek: ok well fist dont use utorrent itll definetly basically crash or f up your server second just use no-ip and if u need to forward your port goto your router and follow the instructions in the server tutorials but DEFINITLEY DO NO WHAT EVER U DO DO NOT USE UTORENT :mad: :mad: :mad: :eek: :eek:[/quote]first of all, tell me Exactly what to put in all the fields. Next, tell me how to turn my server on so that other people can play on it.

Read full topic

item.source: Messup with server being online? what happens when ppl try to log onto my server

item.title: Messup with server being online? what happens when ppl try to log onto my server
item.dc:creator: @needhoster needhoster
item.description:
@needhoster wrote:

[quote=“Goodoo dolls, post:4, topic:241908”]Log into your router with 192.168.1.1 (should be default) Click the Application Support button near the top of the page. Click the Enable Application Support link near the top of the page. Use the Select a computer box to choose a computer to forward ports to. This box contains a list of computer names that are visible on your network.
Click the Add a new user-defined application link near the bottom of the page.
Go ahead and enter the settings shown above into the Edit Application menu and then click Add Definition.

Click the Back button.
Select the applications you just created in the Applications list, then click the Add button to move them to the Hosted Applications box.
When you are finished, click the Done button at the bottom of your screen.

And that is it! You are done! -Taken from portforward.com[/quote]I get that but what the hell do i put in there? like as the port range etc.

Read full topic
item.source: Messup with server being online? what happens when ppl try to log onto my server

item.title: Messup with server being online? what happens when ppl try to log onto my server
item.dc:creator: @Goodoo_dolls Goodoo dolls
item.description:
@Goodoo_dolls wrote:

Log into your router with 192.168.1.1 (should be default) Click the Application Support button near the top of the page. Click the Enable Application Support link near the top of the page. Use the Select a computer box to choose a computer to forward ports to. This box contains a list of computer names that are visible on your network.
Click the Add a new user-defined application link near the bottom of the page.
Go ahead and enter the settings shown above into the Edit Application menu and then click Add Definition.

Click the Back button.
Select the applications you just created in the Applications list, then click the Add button to move them to the Hosted Applications box.
When you are finished, click the Done button at the bottom of your screen.

And that is it! You are done! -Taken from portforward.com

Read full topic
item.source: Messup with server being online? what happens when ppl try to log onto my server

DONT USE UTORRENT TO FORWARD YOUR PORTS!!![/quote]ok i have a 2wire 2701HG-G bell south home monitoring router. How do I port forward and what do I do after that? If you can’t give me an answer, then don’t post u retard.
